page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
This block is situated to the west of Bognor Regis and constitutes much of the {parishes of Pagham and Aldwick.} Over a third of the area is sea and, of the remainder, the majority is { {residential.}There is some farmland and a number of recreational facilities, including a caravan park, holiday camp and Pagham harbour. A residential school belonging to Birmingham Education Authority and an infants school are in the area.
A major social feature is the high proportion of{elderly people,}many of whom come to retire. Since the visit of King George V, the area has been famous for its mild and healthy climate. Associated with this is the area's popularity as a{resort.}Much of the housing is very expensive and there are some private estates.
